analysis.description: A creative coding playground for turning Sonic Pi 2.4 scripts into live-generated music and soundscapes. Ideal for experimenting with programmed sounds, performance sketches, and teaching the basics of music coding.

valueProposition: Provides ready-made Sonic Pi 2.4 code examples to dramatically shorten the learning curve for live-coded music.
Enables educators and creatives to quickly demonstrate programmable sound concepts without building examples from scratch.
Acts as a lightweight reference library for experimenting with new musical ideas in Sonic Pi.

customerSegments.name: Music educators and coding instructors using Sonic Pi in classes or workshops
pain_points: Need simple, tested examples to teach code-based music without preparing all content themselves
Limited time to design engaging demos that clearly show how code maps to sound

customerSegments.name: Hobbyist musicians and creative coders exploring Sonic Pi
pain_points: Difficulty getting started without concrete, working scripts to modify
Lack of inspiration or structure when experimenting with programmable music for the first time

revenueStreams.source: Educational content bundles or workshop materials built around the repository examples
